names.name: makl-confa wrapper around MaKL autoconfigure scripts.

manpage.description:
makl-conf is a wrapper around MaKL autoconfigure scripts. A MaKL autoconfigure script is one using using the following basic framework:
#!/bin/sh
. "${MAKL_DIR}"/cf/makl.init
makl_args_init "$@"
makl_args_handle "$@"
. "${MAKL_DIR}"/cf/makl.term
When invoked, it searches the current working directory for a suitable config file name (see FILES section). If found, the configure script is executed (the executable bit must be asserted for the user) with MAKL variables suitably set in its environment.

usage.arg: script-argsAny argument exported by the autoconf script.

manpage.examples:
Take a look at available options:
$ makl-conf --help
Tell your autoconf script to use a different path for DESTDIR:
$ makl-conf --prefix=/another/prefix/path
Tell MaKL that you want libraries to be built as shared objects and placed in a custom location:
$ makl-conf --enable_shared --dir-lib=/my/lib
manpage.diagnostics: In case of error, makl-conf will bail out with non-zero exit code and appropriate diagnostic message on standard output.
manpage.environment:
The makl-conf command access the following environment variables, via .maklrc or makl.conf configuration files:
MAKL_DIRMaKL base dir which contains autoconf library functions. MAKL_CF_SCRIPTSUsed to extend the list of configuration script names.

files.file: configure, configure.sh, Configure, Configure.sh, config.sh, Config.shFile names which are scanned to find a match in the current working directory.
